summary: SA/DO/O is the recipient of memoranda from H. Clark Schor in response to requests from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These memoranda provide additional information on individuals and entities of interest to the HSCA, detailing the types and quantity of documents held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS) on each. The documents indicate that SA/DO/O served as a point of contact within the organization for information requests related to the JFK assassination investigation, specifically those originating from the HSCA. The memoranda include information on George DeMohrenschildt, Leo Cherne, William Harvey, the International Rescue Committee, Richard Helms, James Angleton, Raymond Rocca, and the Wackenhut Corporation.
significance: SA/DO/O's significance lies in its role as a recipient of information related to the JFK assassination investigation, specifically acting as a point of contact for the HSCA's inquiries. They were responsible for receiving and presumably disseminating information regarding individuals and entities of interest to the HSCA, based on the records held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS).
